{"step_by_step_thinking": "Congenital diaphragmatic hernia prognosis is influenced by several factors. Pulmonary Hypertension is a significant factor as it can lead to severe respiratory distress. Delay in emergent surgery can lead to complications and worsen the prognosis. The size of the defect is also important as larger defects can cause more severe symptoms and complications. However, the gestational age at diagnosis is less important as a prognostic factor because it does not directly influence the severity of the condition or the outcome of the treatment.", "answer_choice": "D"}
